intro: Nesoluma st-johnianum, commonly known as the St. John's lily, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has strap-like, lance-shaped leaves. It produces a tall, erect stem that bears clusters of fragrant blooms, making it a popular ornamental plant. Due to habitat loss, it is also considered a species of conservation concern.
